info.description: Query popular APIs using GraphQL. Schemas include: **Hacker News**, **Reddit**, **GitHub**, **Twitter** and **GraphQLHub**, which contains all the other schemas. GraphQLHub is an open-source project — if you want to add a feature, fix a bug, or just ask a question, you can reach out on [Github](https://github.com/clayallsopp/graphqlhub)!
info.title: GraphQLHub

externalDocs.description: This powers the server behind GraphQLHub.

post.description: You can make a GraphQL query by issuing a POST request with a JSON payload. The payload must have a string called query, and may optionally have a variables object. If the query parameter contains multiple queries, the operationName parameter must be sent to indicate which query to execute.

data.graphQLHub: Use GraphQLHub to explore popular APIs with GraphQL! Created by Clay Allsopp @clayallsopp

get.description: You can make a GraphQL query by issuing a GET request with a query parameter in the querystring

types.name: GraphQLHubAPI
types.description: APIs exposed as GraphQL

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: HackerNewsAPI
types.description: The Hacker News V0 API

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: HackerNewsItem
types.description: Stories, comments, jobs, Ask HNs and even polls are just items. They're identified by their ids, which are unique integers

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: ItemType
types.description: The type of item

types.name: HackerNewsUser
types.description: Users are identified by case-sensitive ids. Only users that have public activity (comments or story submissions) on the site are available through the API.

types.name: HackerNewsAPIV2
types.description: The Hacker News V2 API; this is Relay-compatible (uses Nodes and Connections)

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an ID

types.name: NodeConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection.

types.name: NodeEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

types.name: HackerNewsV2CommentConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

types.name: HackerNewsV2CommentEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

types.name: RedditAPI
types.description: The Reddit API

types.name: RedditSubreddit
types.description: Information about and listings in a subreddit

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: RedditLink
types.description: A link posted to a subreddit

types.name: RedditUser
types.description: Information about a Reddit user

types.name: RedditComment
types.description: A comment on a link

types.name: TimeInterval
types.description: Time interval by which listings are queried

types.name: KeyValueAPI
types.description: An in-memory key-value store

types.name: KeyValueItem
types.description: Item for a key-value pair

types.name: GithubAPI
types.description: The Github API

types.name: GithubCommitAuthor
types.description: Commit author that is not associated with a Github acount

types.name: GithubStatus
types.description: Status of a commit

types.name: TwitterAPI
types.description: The Twitter API

types.name: UserIdentifier
types.description: Either user unique ID, or screen name

types.name: UserIdentity
types.description: Parse user provided identity

types.name: TwitterUser
types.description: Twitter user

types.name: Tweet
types.description: A tweet object

types.name: Retweet
types.description: Retweet of a tweet

types.name: SearchReponse
types.description: Type of search response.

types.name: GiphyRatingType
types.description: The rating of a GIF

types.name: GraphQLHubMutationAPI
types.description: APIs exposed as GraphQL mutations

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL’s execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.
